hl.seg: Tea: Effective cure of Chest Cancer

doc.seg: In a new research it is being told that drinking 3 cups of tea everyday
reduces the danger of chest cancer in women under 50 years of age by 1/3rd.
The research happening in the Moffitt Cancer Center in the American State of Florida, has showed that chances of getting tumor of chest cancer in those women under 50 years of age
is reduced by 37%, who drink at least three cups of tea everyday.
It is also told in the research that it does not help older women even if they drink three or more cups of tea daily.
Specialists think that this is because of the presence of such components in tea that are more effective against such types of cancer tumors, which usually targets women under 50 years of age.
Research was done on 5000 women who had treatment done for Chest Cancer at Moffitt Cancer Center founded in city Tampa of State of Florida.
Their ages are between 20 and 74 years.
Specialists compared their medical records and lifestyle to those women who are free from chest cancer.
Specialists also came to know that tea had its prominent effect on one of the kinds of cancer, Lobes, and it was reduced by 66%.
Every 10th chest cancer patient has this kind of cancer.
This type of chest cancer is dangerous because it is deep inside and usually diagnosed when it has spread alot.
Specialists say that having at least three cups of tea every day can readily reduce the chances of chest cancer in women of lesser age.
They say that incorporating tea as a regular drink in your daily routine helps create immunity against the cancer.
Almost 40,000 women are diagnosed with chest cancer in Britain.

hl.seg: why reduce exercise with the age?
new research

doc.seg: exercise at any age is good for health.
it energizes your heart, reduces the cholesterol level, helps in keeping the weight low, helps in preventing diabetes and slows down the process of Alzheimer or dementia.
unfortunately the ability to exercise reduces in many people with the age.
experts say that exercise keep our body and brain active however age can affect it.
According to the American Medical Association, several health related problems can arise by not doing exercise.
Dr. Patricia Palecca of Mayo Clinic, Minnesota says that an increase in age is a major cause of inability to excercise and lack of bodily activity.
Dr. Patricia teaches medicine at Mayo Clinic.
She lead a study of how heart related diseases and the ability to exercise is related to old age.
The team of doctors used high frequency sound waves to measure the working of the heart.
In which the pumping of the blood by the heart, its contraction and relaxation was studied.
The experts focussed on the left part of the heart which is the main part for pumping blood.
They learnt that as people grew old, there was an increase in faults in the relaxation of the heart.
Dr. Patricia says that as age increases, the faults in the relaxation of the heart begin to appear, and this affects the ability to exercise.
Dr. Garwin Cain was also a part of this study.
He says that we were surprised to see that there is a definite effect of this. And this clearly proves how deep a relation the worsening of exercise has with the relaxation of the heart.
Sometimes blood pressure can cause faults in the working of the heart and can become a cause of heart diseases.
If the doctor and the patient work together on the faults of the heart, they can achieve the benefits of excercise, despite the increase in age.
A detailed report of this has been published in the magazine of the American Medical Association.
